reviewText: Columbo :Requiem For A Falling Star was released in 1973. It starred Anne Baxter. One of the best ever Columbo episodes. Fans of Anne Baxter will like this the most.

The fifth episode of this second season, REQUIEM FOR A FALLING STAR, was broadcasted on Jan. 21st, 1973. It's also possible to watch this episode in the DVD standard by purchasing Columbo - The Complete Second Season. In addition to this episode, director Richard Quine directed two other Columbo episodes: Columbo Collector's Edition: Dagger Of The Mind and Columbo Collector's Edition: Double Exposure. He also directed a few interesting movies back in the 50's and the 60's such as Bell, Book and Candle or The World of Suzie Wong. Two actors of the golden era of Hollywood are the guest stars of the episode; Anne All About Eve Baxter and Mel Scaramouche Ferrer, no more and no less. Please also note the presence, as herself, of Edith Head, the legendary costume designer who won seven Oscars between 1950 and 1974 in the Best Costume Design category. The screenplay, written by Jackson Gillis, is very inventive as we don't know before the very end of the episode if the murderer really wanted to kill his victim and if it was the case, for what reason. Highly recommended. A VHS to keep in your library.

This is another great Columbo episode with guest stars Anne Baxter, Frank Converse and Pippi Scott. As always with Columbo episodes there is great acting and great writing. This episode was directed by Richard Quine, written by Jackson Gillis, created by Richard Levinson & William Link, and produced by Dean Hargrove. This story takes place on a Hollywood movie lot.
